channel.title: maya on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist
channel.description: Recent content in maya on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist

item.title: difficulty level reckoning
item.description: after a bit of first hand experience during my time away from the project with difficulty level, I have decided that a traditional system is indeed needed for my own game.

item.title: the headless woman & the skip button
item.description: it had been awhile since I modeled a human from scratch, so I started one to use as the final boss; shake things up a bit from the machines. progress is going smoothly, mainly because my references seem to be well crafted added a skip button for the dialogue, in case people like to die quickly and numerously.

item.title: slowly regaining momentum
item.description: it is beginning to happen though added a data privacy button for opting out and lighting effects for the desert world

item.title: feeling lousy
item.description: two or three days of depression, so I’m working on a holiday. at least it is my least favorite one, maybe second to new year’s, i suppose didn’t really do much.

item.title: painting giant beam particle textures
item.description: spent the whole week painting textures and creating shaders for the big attack for the primary attack of the second boss. had some issues with photoshop’s recognition of my wacom tablets pressure sensitivity, it was weird and I could have swore it was working.

item.title: boss ship 2 rigged
item.description: finally started setting up the second boss, it is tougher going than I had anticipated. for whatever reason, it doesn’t feel like I gave as much consideration beforehand to exactly how this particular boss would articulate what its possible attack patterns may be I then began to realise I hadn’t decided where either of the remaining two boss’ weaknesses were going to be located either.

item.title: sporadic progression
item.description: have only been able to manage to be productive every other week or so. today was the first day i felt like I worked a real day all year the terrain for planet 3 is almost done after around one full day’s work, just the baking left to do, but I have many adjustments that are still pending testing still really difficult to make myself play the game to test things.

item.title: many changes, most recent: item ability functional
item.description: it actually seems to work… at first test… i just can’t use old save data. idk how imma add shit and not break the save data signature… i didn’t even change it, but old files load funny.

item.title: la, la, bumba
item.description: i changed like a million things to fix a hundred… if that isn’t a saying, quote me. idk what to even test anymore december I am supposed to add all these people… the weapon change system seems good… recent adjustments to equipment strength seems appropriate… i need to figure out the relic/accessories, the ability system… what am I missing?

item.title: short cut?
item.description: today i modeled and rendered a blaster icon in an hour and a half… stark contrast to the circuit board, but it was a pretty simple model.

item.title: healing item icons complete
item.description: took awhile, but happy with the end result

item.title: boss ship 3 model complete
item.description: got the model imported, all the materials setup and the textures compressed. still need to program the fight and do attack animations

item.title: uv tip
item.description: omg, this will save me so many clicks Modeling > Mesh Display > Soften/Harden Edges Options : Texture Borders

item.title: vertex color in maya
item.description: started retopologising boss ship 3 and i actually figured out a way to see the vertex color data from zbrush in Maya, which should make the process a bit more friendly and eliminate the use of TopoGun altogether.

item.title: procrastinate the date
item.description: my birthday vacation seems to have inadvertently become a summer stay, either that or I’ve reached a slump. slowly, but surely i am finding fresh motive to continue. there was a bit of a temporary detour in attempt to get better internet infrastructure in my home, but in the end my efforts have proven fruitless.

item.title: spaceship 07 final low resolution model
item.description: ended up swapping to Maya halfway through retopologizing this model. sections started to get really close together, even having tried to eliminate such areas in the modeling stage i feel as though i have discovered this before, but the new Maya modeling toolkit is actually better than using TopoGun.

item.title: spaceship 07 decimated
item.description: finished up the high resolution model sculpting and vertex colouring in zBrush, got the model decimated and have started laying out the final topology in topogun had some strange issues merging subtools in z… ended up reloading a save to find a piece disappearing and reappearing, sort of flickering as the camera would rotate.

item.title: cusp versus edge: fight!
item.description: life is so difficult to navigate lately… this is coming from someone who doesn’t go anywhere or do anything except live his pursuit i am either on the cusp of something brilliant, some huge revelation or new threshold of understanding; or at the edge of some immeasurable disaster, a great unravelling of everything i have known or built and perhaps disillusion of everything that may ever come to be it is tough to say, maybe I don’t wanna label it, or speak the thought into existence progress is coming along well on the seventh spaceship.

item.title: boss ship 2 initial topology done
item.description: still need to get the count down a bit and lay out the UVs in Maya, then texture and a tiny bit of rigging

item.title: deja poo
item.description: almost finished the final low resolution model within the year, tired of clicking. gonna look back and see what i was working on a year ago, exactly. hopefully doesn’t make me too sad, hahah

item.title: progresso?
item.description: finished the hummingbirds course. also completed the decimation/export process from zBrush and got the low-res model going. managed to use some of the old topology from spaceShip 5, so have a decent start not sure why i feel like i didn’t do anything, that sounds productive doesn’t it?

item.title: boss 2 zBrush complete
item.description: finished the hi-res painting and sculpting for the second boss ship model. i have gotten a decent collection of generic alpha shapes over the course of this project and am getting used to using zremesher on everything i need to paint on monday i plan to decimate the model and begin topology construction to get the poly count of the final low-res mesh as low as possible.

item.title: boss 2 sub-D complete
item.description: didn’t get a lot of time to work on the actual project this week, spent most of my time studying. hopefully get the zBrush work done next week at least, who knows

item.title: unwritten words
item.description: i think i need to start documenting more things in this log… working on the second terrain and i realised i couldn’t really remember the exact workflow i used, just a couple notes on the polygon count that were actually misleading after digging into the old project files.

item.title: shrimp progress
item.description: i was seriously hating this monday. by the end of day 2, i was happy enough to carry on to zBrush the next day
